texts.value: Catalyzes the reversible conversion of beta-D-fructose 1,6-bisphosphate (FBP) into two triose phosphate and plays a key role in glycolysis and gluconeogenesis (PubMed:14766013). In addition, may also function as scaffolding protein (By similarity)
Thermal denaturation midpoint (Tm) is 54.4 degrees Celsius.
Carbohydrate degradation; glycolysis; D-glyceraldehyde 3-phosphate and glycerone phosphate from D-glucose: step 4/4
Homotetramer. Interacts with SNX9 and WAS (By similarity). Interacts with FBP2; the interaction blocks FBP2 inhibition by physiological concentrations of AMP and reduces inhibition by Ca(2+)
In skeletal muscle, accumulates around the M line and within the I band, colocalizing with FBP2 on both sides of the Z line in the absence of Ca(2+)

disease.description: A metabolic disorder associated with increased hepatic glycogen and hemolytic anemia. It may lead to myopathy with exercise intolerance and rhabdomyolysis.

texts.value: The disease is caused by variants affecting the gene represented in this entry
In vertebrates, three forms of this ubiquitous glycolytic enzyme are found, aldolase A in muscle, aldolase B in liver and aldolase C in brain
Belongs to the class I fructose-bisphosphate aldolase family

features.description: Necessary for preference for fructose 1,6-bisphosphate over fructose 1-phosphate
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO1); alternate
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2); alternate
in GSD12; reduces thermal stability; 3-fold decrease in catalytic efficiency mostly due to reduced substrate affinity; dbSNP:rs121909534
in GSD12; likely benign variant; does not affect thermal stability; 4-fold decrease in catalytic efficiency due to reduced enzyme activity; dbSNP:rs138824667
